text: Culverhouse is an English topographic surname, which originally meaning a person who tended or lived near a dovecote, derived from the Old English culfrehus ("dovecote").Dictionary of American Family Names. "Culverhouse Family History", Oxford University Press, 2013. Retrieved on 21 January 2016. Dovecotes were common on English estates in the medieval period. The name may refer to: *Gay Culverhouse (1947–2020), American academic administrator *Hugh Culverhouse (1919–1994), American lawyer and NFL team owner *Ian Culverhouse (born 1964), English footballer *Mike Culverhouse (born 1951), British police officer *Peter Culverhouse (1972–2003), British cancer patient ==References== Category:English-language surnames Category:Surnames of British Isles origin Category:English toponymic surnames
title: Culverhouse
